byline.contributor: Marlise Simons and Somini Sengupta contributed reporting.

abstract: Human rights groups are upset over Sudan Pres Omar al-Bashir's plans to attend World War II victory commemoration in China and United Nations session; say that countries should not ignore international warrants for his arrest on war crimes charges, which he has eluded since they were first issued in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Omar al-Bashir has eluded prosecution on international charges of war crimes in Darfur, but two scheduled trips are drawing new attention to his case.

headline.main: Rights Groups Stirring Over Sudan President’s Travels
headline.print_headline: Rights Groups Point to Arrest Warrants as Sudan’s President Gets Set to Travel

snippet: Omar al-Bashir has eluded prosecution on international charges of war crimes in Darfur, but two scheduled trips are drawing new attention to his case.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
